Two U.S. senators, Democrat Bob Menendez and Republican John McCain, on Tuesday urged FIFA not to re-elect Blatter for his fifth term as president in light of his “continued support” for Russia hosting the 2018 World Cup.

In a letter to the FIFA Congress, the senators said the economic benefits from hosting the tournament would contravene the sanctions imposed on Russia over its intervention in Ukraine. The body should elect a president who’ll “work to deny the Putin regime the privilege” of staging the World Cup, it said.

For Russia, the timing about everything that doesn't work out for them is suspicious; caring about Gay rights is suspicious (since it highlights Russia's relative lack of gay rights), American missile defense is suspicious (because the United States would totally launch a nuclear attack, despite all of the other non-nuclear countries still being in existence), American concern for Ukrainian territorial integrity is suspicious, along with anything else that makes Russia look bad. The Kremlin doesn't believe in coincidences or things occurring independently of Russia- many actually believe gay marriage is driven by a desire to make Russia look bad, instead of domestic cultural changes in society.
Frankly, no one but the United States is in a position to do anything about FIFA's corruption- the EU is too timid and everyone else lacks the resources to pursue FIFA.

It's just the timing. Corruption among FIFA ranks has been ongoing for decades. Now with re-elections coming up tomorrow and Washington angry at Blatter for keeping the WC in Russia, it just seems a little too <i>coincidental<i> that the FBI and IRS decided <i> now <i> to crackdown on FIFA.
Much like how Washington pressured Greece not to accept Moscow's pipeline proposals.
But then again, its just paranoia when Putin thinks the west is out to get him.

Amusingly, the Russia bid bothers me less than the Qatar one. I hate their government, don't get me wrong, but I never had a doubt about their fitness to host the games. They have multiple soccer stadiums in several major cities. They have a lot of pre-existing facilities that can be used easily. Usually politics are not used as an excuse to cancel international sporting events. Countries may choose to boycott, but the events are never cancelled. Obviously bribery went into the pick, but it was a reasonable pick. You could believe the pick could have also occurred on merit, not just bribery.

With Qatar, however, it is very clear that they do not have the existing facilities to host the games and to build them is costing a lot of lives. It is very clear that based on merit, Qatar has no business hosting the games. They only got them on bribery. Even South Africa and Brazil were reasonable picks on merit.

Of course, Russia is playing the kid who has been poking at another kid and then cries after he gets punched. They also seem to see every single action by the western powers as a plot against them because they were not able to take over all of Ukraine and got a lot of blowback over their <i>coup de main<i> that gave them power over Crimea.
